title: Leaders pay homage to Gandhiji, Shastriji
text:
Tribune Reporters
Mussoorie, October 2
Floral tributes were paid to father of the nation, Mahatma Gandhi, and former Prime Minister Lal Bahadur Shastri on their birth anniversary here today. Mussoorie MLA Ganesh Joshi, MC president Manmohan Singh Mall, Tourism Promotion and Culture Preservation Committee president Jot Singh Gunsola, former MC president OP Uniyal celebrated the occasion by unfurling the national flag and offering floral tribute at the statue and portrait of the two great leaders in a function held at Saraswati Shishu Mandir, near SBI. The leaders shed light on the life of two leaders and remembered their sacrifice and contribution in freedom struggle and rebuilding the nation. President of the Gandhi Niwas Society Madan Mohan Sharma and former president Shailendar Karnawal appealed to students and the gathered audience to follow the path shown by the great leaders. Public representatives and residents also offered floral tribute at the leaders and unfurled the national flag at Gandhi Chowk. Rashim Karnawal, Jaya Karnawal, Sashi Rawat, Beena Panwar, Rami Devi, Manmohan Singh, Chandra Prakash Godiyal, Ravindar Goyal, Ashok Agarwal, Arvind Gusain, Arvind Sonkar, Satish Dhaundiyal and others were present on the occasion. DM offers floral tribute
Haridwar: People remembered Mahatma Gandhi and former Prime Minister Lal Bahadur Shastri on their birth anniversaries. District Magistrate Harish Chandra Semwal offered floral tributes at their portraits at the Collectorate office, Roshanabad. He urged people to follow in their footsteps. Students of Maa Anandmayi Sewa Sadan School recited bhajans. City Magistrate Mohammed Nasir and Congress workers also paid tributes to the two great personalities. Congress city unit president OP Chauhan said both Gandhiji and Lal Bahadur Shastri were instrumental in making Indians realise the importance of humility, truth, wisdom, hard work and non-violence. UKD (Progressive) leader Uday Ram Semwal recalled the visit of Mahatma Gandhi to Uttarakhand and Lal Bahadur Shastri’s visit to Dehradun to inaugurate Clock Tower in the city. City legislators Madan Kaushik, Aadesh Chauhan, Chandrasekhar Bhattewala, Swami Yatishwaranand and Mayor Manoj Garg also paid tributes to them. Residents vow to follow Gandhiji’s ideals Pithoragarh: In Champawat and Pithoragarh districts, residents paid respects to Gandhiji and Shastriji and vowed to follow their ideals. The programmes in Pithoragarh began with hoisting of the national flagat all government, semi-government offices and educational institutes at 7.45 am, followed by garlanding the statues of Gandhiji and Shastriji. “The programmes were followed by a Sarv Dharm Sabha at Gandhi Chowk in Pithoragarh town and several cultural and intellectual programmes in various schools and at the local Nagar Palika Parishad hall,” a press note issued by the Information Department stated. In Champawat district, District Magistrate Dependra Chaudhari hoisted the National Flag. He also kick started several sports competitions being organised by local schools.
